name: Hottest summer
description: the highest average afternoon temperature in June July and August.

name: Coldest winter
description: the lowest average night-time temperature in December January and February.

name: Coolest summer
description: the lowest average afternoon temperature in June July and August.

name: Mildest winter
description: the highest average afternoon temperature in December January and February.

name: Coldest spring
description: the lowest average daily temperature in March April and May.

name: Coldest year-round
description: the lowest average of all daily temperatures for the year.

name: Warmest year-round
description: the highest average of all daily temperatures for the year.

name: Most freezing days
description: the greatest number of days annually with the lowest temperature at or below 0°C.

name: Fewest freezing days
description: the fewest number of days annually with the lowest temperature at or below 0 °C.

name: Most hot days (30°C or above)
description: the greatest number of days annually with a daily high temperature of 30°C or above.

name: Most cold days (-20°C or less)
description: the greatest number of days annually with a daily low temperature of -20°C or below.

name: Most hot and cold days
description: the greatest number of days annually with daily highs of 30°C or above and daily lows of -20°C or below.

name: Warmest spring
description: the highest average daily temperature in March April and May.

name: Warmest fall
description: the highest average daily temperature in September October and November.

name: Wettest city (rain and snow)
description: the greatest total annual rain and snow.

name: Driest city
description: the least amount of total annual rain and snow.

name: Snowiest city
description: the greatest total annual snowfall (cm).

name: Lowest snowfall
description: the least amount of total annual snowfall (cm).

name: Snowiest fall
description: the greatest total snowfall in September October and November.

name: Snowiest spring
description: the greatest total snowfall in March April and May.

name: Snowfall as a % of precipitation
description: the annual total snowfall (cm) as a % of annual total precipitation (mm).

name: Rainiest city
description: the greatest total annual rainfall (mm).

name: Most wet days
description: the greatest number of days annually with measurable precipitation at or above 0.2 mm.

name: Most very wet days (25 mm or more)
description: the greatest number of days annually with precipitation at or more than 25 mm.

name: Most dry days
description: the greatest number of days annually with no measurable precipitation.

name: Most snow days
description: the greatest number of days annually with measurable snowfall at or above 0.2 cm.

name: Fewest snow days
description: the fewest number of days annually with measurable snowfall at or above 0.2 cm.

name: Most heavy snowfall days (10 cm or more)
description: the greatest number of days annually with a snowfall at or above 10 cm.

name: Most huge snowfall days (25 cm or more)
description: the greatest number of days annually with a snowfall at or above 25 cm.

name: Longest snow cover season (days)
description: the greatest number of days annually with snow covering the ground to a depth of at least 1 cm.

name: Most deep snow cover days (10 cm or more)
description: the greatest number of days annually with snow covering the ground to a depth of at least 10 cm.

name: Greatest average snow depth January 31
description: the deepest median daily snow depth on January 31.

name: Most freezing rain days
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of freezing rain or drizzle.

name: Most blowing snow days
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of blowing snow.

name: Most thunderstorm days
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of a thunderstorm.

name: Fewest thunderstorm days
description: the fewest number of days annually with an occurrence of a thunderstorm.

name: Foggiest city (days)
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of fog (fog ice fog or freezing fog).

name: Fewest fog days
description: the fewest number of days annually with an occurrence of fog (fog ice fog or freezing fog).

name: Most smoke and haze days
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of smoke or haze.

name: Sunniest year-round
description: the greatest number of hours annually with sunshine.

name: Least sunshine year-round
description: the fewest number of hours annually with sunshine.

name: Sunniest winter
description: the greatest number of hours of sunshine in December January and February.

name: Sunniest summer
description: the greatest number of hours of sunshine in June July and August.

name: Sunniest spring
description: the greatest number of hours of sunshine in March April and May.

name: Sunniest fall
description: the greatest number of hours of sunshine in September October and November.

name: Most sunny days year-round
description: the greatest number of days annually with an occurrence of sunshine.

name: Fewest sunny days year-round
description: the fewest number of days annually with an occurrence of sunshine.

name: Most sunny days in cold months
description: the greatest number of days from November through March inclusive with an occurrence of sunshine.

name: Most sunny days in warm months
description: the greatest number of days from May through September inclusive with an occurrence of sunshine.

name: Most heating degree-days
description: the greatest number of heating degree-days annually (accumulated average daily temperature below 18°C).

name: Most cooling degree-days
description: the greatest number of cooling degree-days annually (accumulated average daily temperature above 18°C).

name: Most growing degree-days
description: the greatest number of growing degree-days annually (accumulated average daily temperature above 5°C).

name: Highest average pressure
description: the highest hourly average sea level pressure (kPa) annually.

name: Lowest average pressure
description: the lowest hourly average sea level pressure (kPa) annually.

name: Greatest average pressure difference
description: the greatest difference between highest and lowest monthly average sea level pressure (kPa).

name: Most hours with low visibility
description: the greatest number of hours per year where the visibility is less than 1 km.

name: Clearest skies year-round
description: the greatest number of hours annually with total cloud amount between 0 and 2 tenths.

name: Cloudiest skies year-round
description: the greatest number of hours annually with total cloud amount between 8 and 10 tenths.

name: Most clear skies in summer
description: the greatest number of hours in June July and August with total cloud amount between 0 and 2 tenths.

name: Windiest city year-round
description: the highest average hourly wind speed (km/h) annually.

name: Lightest wind speed year-round
description: the lowest average hourly wind speed (km/h) annually.

name: Windiest winter
description: the highest average hourly wind speed (km/h) in December January and February.

name: Windiest summer
description: the highest average hourly wind speed (km/h) in June July and August.

name: Most days with light wind (5 km/h or less)
description: the greatest number of days with at least one hour's wind speed at or less than 5 km/h.

name: Most windy days (40 km/h or more)
description: the greatest number of days annually with at least one hour's wind speed above 40 km/h.

name: Extreme wind chill
description: the highest wind chill in the period between 1952 and 2000.

name: Most high wind chill days (-30 or less)
description: the greatest number of days with an occurrence of wind chill less than -30.

name: Humidex days at or above 30
description: the greatest number of days annually with humidex at or above 30.

name: High humidex days at or above 35
description: the greatest number of days annually with humidex at or above 35.

name: Most humid summer city
description: the highest average hourly vapour pressure (kPa) in June July and August.

name: Driest winter air
description: the lowest average hourly vapour pressure (kPa) in December January and February.

name: Driest summer air
description: the lowest average hourly vapour pressure (kPa) in June July and August.
